sub_title: Research assistant📊 Student of artificial intelligence🤖 and cognitive science🧠 with a refugee background
summary:
I want to contribute to the science of brain🧠 , behavior👣 and other complex systems🌊 by the means of artificial intelligence🤖 and good research design📑 . Therefore I work as a research assistant for FearLess: a study that investigates fear extinction in adolescents with behavioral tasks, fMRI and skin conductance measurements. I also just finished helping with the redesign of the Cognitive Neuroscience course as a student assistant (adaptation of the experimental design to VR and GUI, programming behavioral tasks, writing manuals etc.). Before that I did research internships in a cognitive neuropsychology lab (EEG) and a cognitive neuroscience lab (programming a behavioral task with Bayesian updating) and followed extra courses about brain and development, biology, algorithms.

You could view my GitHub profile here: https://github.com/khna89

projects.title: Dutch in Ukrainian
projects.description: An interactive course of Dutch language with translation to Ukrainian. We saw a lot of Dutch-English courses and some Dutch-Russian courses, but a general Dutch-Ukrainian course on a good interactive platform didn't exist when we started (I hope there are already some out there). Made it as a volunteer for Dutch lessons for Ukrainian refugees in Den Bosch. You don't need the paid subscription for Memrise to use it, the free one is enough. The app is very nice, try it out!

Research Assistant by L-CID  | Research MSc Student Neuroscience & Cognition

projects.title: Testing performance of sklearn classifiers on scRNA-seq dataset
projects.description:
The code was written from scratch in order to compare the performance of a number of models on a single cell RNA-sequencing dataset in a systematic way. I have designed the code to load and preprocess the data and the architecture in which the models are tested, the results are collected, displayed and visualized. Scikit-learn library was used to train and test machine learning models, Numpy and Pandas were used to work with the datastructures, Matplotlib and Mglearn were used to visualize the results.

The selection of the models and the hyperparameters to test is the result of the group work with Maxymillian Martys and Marijn Vroegh within the course Jung, M., Saygili, G., Stowell, D., Zamberlan, F. & Schmalzried, D. (Feb. - Jul. 2022). Research Workshop CSAI [university course]. Bachelor program Cognitive Science and Artificial Intelligence, Tilburg University, The Netherlands.

The dataset used contains single cell RNA sequencing data. I’ve chosen this data because I find molecular biology fascinating and I’m actually taking a number of biology courses just for fun. The dataset is Allen Mouse Brain (AMB), as preprocessed by Michielsen, Reinders & Mahfouz, available here https://zenodo.org/record/4557712 .

projects.title: How you use Netflix: interactive data visualization with R
projects.description:
I've made an app that lets you see how much you watched Netflix and which shows you watched the most. I used R (shiny, flexdashboard, basic graphics) for this project.

During my Christmas break I decided to use the knowledge I gained at the university so far. I think practice is important, and it's one thing to score at exams and another thing to realize an idea from scratch. In order to practice project-oriented thinking I combined what I've learned at the uni with some googling and that's where it led me. 

Here is the app: https://lnkd.in/eS54u-zu . Here is the git repository of the app:
https://lnkd.in/eEsEgk3y . In order to retrieve your data from Netflix follow their guide here: https://lnkd.in/ekDe6e_e . It's quite simple, but you'd have to wait for a couple of hours after you've asked them for the data.
 
In the readme file of the repository you could find more information on the project, in particular how to use your data safely or how to anonymize it if you want to. The data as it's provided by Netflix contains your user names and countries from which you were watching, and also the type of the device you were using. You could also use my anonymized data to test the app (also in the repository).
 
The idea to do something with our Netflix consumption data belongs to Soldado Koval 🙂

The project is quite simple, but I think it served its purpose. And now the new semester starts. Let's see what I manage to create after it :-)

projects.title: Erasmus IP project “Walking, Watching and (a)Wakening in Venice”
projects.description:
Walking, Watching, A-Wakening in Venice (6-20 July 2013), a multidisciplinary programme coordinated by Università Statale di Milano in partnership with the University of Venice Ca’ Foscari, the University of Warwick and the University of Szeged, the course aims to make sense of Venice’s unique multilayered environment, its interweaving of urban and natural landscapes, of traditional heritage and (post)modern realities. Students learn to interpret this complexity from various methodological viewpoints and produce artistic representations of their embodied experience of space during the program. Multimedia portfolios are prepared containing daily diary entries, photographic, and musical materials, and creative writing. The two weeks-long IP terminates with a final multimedia storytelling performance. The programme includes Modules on “Representations of Venice: Literature, Theatre, Cinema”, “Psychogeography and Individual Perceptions of Space”, “Travel and Its Inscription on the Urban Landscape: from the Spice Route to Virtual Tourism”. It offers ‘peripatetic lessons’, walking tours where international academic scholars, local experts, and practitioners of traditional skills lead students through landscapes with multiple significance, from “Disneyland Venice” to lesser known areas of the city and the lagoon. Workshop activites focus on Creative Writing, Dramaturgy and Storytelling Skills, Commedia dell’Arte’s multilinguism and body language, as well as ICT Exploitations for the Humanities. Demonstrations by local craftspeople and artists encourage students to use their Five Senses to explore past and present histories and philosophies of Venetian cuisine, the art of glass, and the tactics of living with/on water.

I created a dance movie 'aLtteRnAtive trip dancing dérive' created as a result of participation.

projects.title: INCUBATOR
projects.description: A performance in which all the life of a Human flows during one academic hour. "INCUBATOR" was created in collaboration with Valentin Czyn, the actor of the butoh dance theatre "Derevo" (Dresden, Germany) at that time. I participated in the project as an assistant director and as a performer. The premiere of the show happened on the 6th of September 2009 in Tchew, Poland. The performance won a "Visual Hit" award at the tehatre festival Zdarzenie, in Tchew, Poland. The description of the performance in Russian and the media feedback can be found here http://teatr-group-14.livejournal.com/4045.html

projects.title: "I SEEK U:) VIRTUAL LIFE"
projects.description: A documentary theatre performance based on stories that happened in the Internet - a result of the investigation on how virtuality changes the relationships between people and the people's identities. The show was created by "TK-14" experimental theatre group in Kiev, the premiere happened on the 27th of June 2009 in Gallery "Lavra", Kiev, Ukraine. The show combines video-documentation and video art, mime, contemporary dance, drama and illusion. The description in Russian and the feedback from the audience and from the media can be found here: http://teatr-group-14.livejournal.com/1004.html . I participated in the project as a choreographer and as a performer.

authors.headline: Research assistant📊 Student of artificial intelligence🤖 and cognitive science🧠 with a refugee background

profile_positions.description: I'm excited to contribute to the field of neuroscience as a research assistant of Fearless, a project that utilizes MRI and other physiological measurements to study fear extinction. In my role, I will conduct MRI scans, program behavioral tasks, recruit participants and contribute to data management.
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant

profile_positions.description:
I help to design experiments for the Cognitieve Neuroscience course and I assist with various tasks within the Statistics II course. 

For Cognitive Neuroscience I'm involved in designing experiments collecting physiological measurements (EEG and skin conductance), and also in presenting the decision making experiment I coded for my research internship. Together with other student assistants we formulate the experiment's design (theory, hypothesis, operationalization) and we write the scripts that the students should follow in order to conduct the experiment, analyze collected data and make conclusions. 

For Statistics II I help with troubleshooting of practical exercises in R Studio and I answer questions about statistical methods to which I do know the answers :-)
profile_positions.title: Teaching Assistant

profile_positions.description: Re-coding an experiment in Python which was originally developed in MATLAB
profile_positions.title: Research Internship

profile_positions.description: At my dream internship I was honored to learn from the research of the team of Marion I. van den Heuvel on mother-infant bonding. I'm fascinated that we've found each other because my dream is to use AI for neuroscientific research and development, and the team of dr. van den Heuvel already works via the means of EEG and AI. Excited for what the future might hold and hope to be useful in this new (for me) team :-)
profile_positions.title: Research Intern

profile_positions.description:
CEDOS is an independent, non-partisan, non-commercial think tank and NGO promoting the values of social justice and evidence-based decision making. CEDOS researches and analyzes government policies and social processes and implements projects in various spheres: migration, education, housing, democracy.

Responsibilities:
- Create and realize communications strategy and information
campaigns
- Coordinate designers, animators, video-engineers, data
visualization specialists to create communication products
- Organize public events
- Manage social networks presence

Example:
A joint project of Ukrainian Ministry of Education and Science and CEDOS think tank was an information campaign with a goal to make educational choices of Ukrainian youth more evidence-based. I coordinated designers, programmers, celebrities and material resources to reach more than 100 000 Ukrainian pupils and their parents. According to the research of the Ministry the campaign did positively influence the situation.

Achievements:
- The proportion of proactive media appearances relative to the
reactive ones increased from 5% to 45%
- Important stakeholders including ministers and MPs follow and
react to organization at social networks
- Attendance at events at or above planned levels
profile_positions.title: Communications Manager - strategies, operations optimisation, PR, SMM, campaigning with a ministry

profile_positions.description:
TfD NGO works with communities all over Ukraine to analyse their problems by means of theatre, creatively voice these issues through interactive theatre performances and influence policies related to the respective issues. Partners: UN Women, UNHCR, USAID, feminist and IDP's NGOs and labour unions.

Projects with my involvement:
Coordination, communications and facilitation for international activist empowerment project “Bridges of Solidarity” (7 countries, around 400 participants) supported by Friedrich Ebert Stiftung – February 2017 – spring 2018
Communications, facilitation and participatory action research for TfD and UN Women joint research&advocacy project “Social/Forum Theatre with Women IDPs” – July – December 2016
Communications, analysis and facilitation for “Promoting Peace through Dialogue by the Means of Theatre” supported and mentored by UCBI – February – July 2016
Communications, community outreach and facilitation for “Trust and Dialogue as the Guarantee for the Development of the Community” realised as part of the community cohesion element of the UNDP in Ukraine – September 2015 – February 2016

Achievements:
Ukrainian local and national authorities including Vice Premier Minister and the Minister of TOT and IDP and Executive Director of UN Women actively participated in the events of the organization and included our recommendations in their working plans and programs. 
More than 10 projects realized, majority of them fully supported by donor organizations.
More than 5 thousand people in around 50 cities and towns physically joined the events of the NGO due to the activities through the mentioned channels and mediums.
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder - empowerment trainings, strategic management, fundraising, PR, SMM

profile_positions.description:
FaceNews is one of the top-30 online media in Ukraine and one of not so many independent media out of these top-30. Is dedicated to giving an independent and balanced point of view on Ukrainian politicum and the questions related to the war against Russian agression. 

Responsibitilites:
Create articles, interviews, video and photo reports, news.
Translate news and articles from English to Russian. 
Actively contribute to the program planning.

Achievements:
Author of a special project 'Half-Year of the Rada. New Faces'.
Created three new exclusive 'special topics' with the materials of current interest: 'To Live Anew: International Experience', 'The War Firsthand', 'Corruption In Our Lives'.
The portal started to get comments from international experts.
The speakers database of the media increased three times.
profile_positions.title: Journalist - parliamentary correspondent, social and political columnist

profile_positions.description: Grateful for this opportunity to see how the politically conscious community art should be done. Inspired by Banner I co-founded a "Theatre for Dialogue" NGO back in Ukraine. As an intern I created a new website for the company and also helped with several Banner's gigs for labour unions.

company.name: Center for Ukrainian Refugees in Den Bosch

volunteer_experiences.description: A body of research shows engaging in an activity that increases social capital helps people who suffered a mass traumatic event to recover. Therefore I help my partner to give interactive an supportive group lessons of Dutch to Ukrainian war refugees on the location in Den Bosch. I develop curriculum for my group and a number of levels of the Memrise app course. The Memrise course could be accessed  for free here: https://app.memrise.com/course/6205403/nederlands-db/
